trans-unit.target: TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_SEQ_00<tab>Eilis requires you to supply the lines of Tidegate.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_SEQ_01<tab>Eilis has asked you to deliver rations to the two tidegates. See one serving to the hands of Nortmoen in the north, and Sthalrhet to the south.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_SEQ_02<tab>You have delivered both servings of rations and borne witness to the sibling rivalry forewarned. Notify Eilis that the provisions have reached their destinations.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_SEQ_03<tab>While Eilis bemoans the brothers' bickering, she trusts the pair will work in lockstep when war comes to the wall.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_000<tab>Guarding a wall so vast as Tidegate requires the manpower of two brigades, and maintaining a unified defense requires they act in tandem.

TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_001<tab>This task has been entrusted to the brigades of the brothers Nortmoen and Sthalrhet, yet I fear they hold each other in esteem far from fraternal, bickering over the slightest of unintended slights.

TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_002<tab>And so I need ask an outsider, namely you, to bring provisions to Nortmoen of the north side and Sthalrhet of the south side, to allay any appearance of impropriety.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_003<tab>We've set aside two perfectly equal sets of rations for them, though you'll likely have your hands full convincing them of that.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_NORTMOEN_000_010<tab>Aye, I am Nortmoen, adventurer. What business have you here?
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_NORTMOEN_000_020<tab>Ah, rations? An adventurer bearing rations is always welcome...but I cannot help but think you bear even more rations for my brother's men.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_STHALRHET_000_030<tab>If you have come looking for Sthalrhet, you've found him. Now, what of it?
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_STHALRHET_000_040<tab>Ah, but what is this you have brought us? Salted fish? You insult my men with brine-soaked brill while my brother dines on the fresh fruits of the sea?
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_050<tab>I take it you witnessed their silly sibling rivalry firsthand, and now understand why some wonder whether the two can cooperate long enough to hold the wall.
TEXT_GAIUSC807_01031_EILIS_000_051<tab>But nothing unites like a common enemy, and I have no doubt the brothers will set aside their petty differences when faced with the greater danger.
